lines.text: [When a guest at her party starts to laugh]

[thinking]
Oh, it's not a failure after all.

[Talking about Clarissa in 1923]
She broke my heart, and you can't love like that twice.
Oh what snobs the English are. How they love dressing up and doing homage. Look at them!
What a lark! What a plunge!

[Mrs. Dalloway's first lines in the film - thinking, voice over]
Those ruffians, the Gods, shan't have it all their own way. Those Gods will never lose a chance of hurting, thwarting, and spoiling human lives.
Of course, now I think there are no Gods, there is no-one to blame.

[thinking, voice over]
That young man killed himself, but I don't pity him. I'm somehow glad he could do it, throw it away. It's made me feel the beauty - somehow very like him - less afraid.

[to Peter]
Here I am, at last.

[thinking, voice over]
Mrs. Dalloway, Mrs. Dalloway, and not even Clarissa anymore. No more marrying, no more having children, just Mrs. Dalloway. Mrs. Richard Dalloway who is to give a party.

[thinking, voice over]
It's all over for me. The sheets stretched and the beds narrow.
